section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of reasonable hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will schedule and perform such maintenance during any time of the day, including weekdays.
explanation: The first sentence promises continuous operation 'twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays.' However, the second sentence contradicts this by stating that i-on will perform maintenance 'during any time of the day, including weekdays.' This creates an ambiguity. If maintenance can be performed at any time, then the promise of continuous operation is not absolute, and the extent of potential downtime is undefined. The phrases 'continuously' and 'any time of the day, including weekdays' are misaligned.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 20th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The first sentence states that the customer is responsible for the payment of $450. The second sentence introduces a contradiction by stating payments must be made by the 20th of each month beginning on April 1st, 1999. This payment date contradicts the fact the contract was written and signed on April 6th 1999, meaning that the customer would have had to pay before signing the contract. This introduces a contradiction, as the April 1st deadline is impossible to adhere to, creating a nonsensical or potentially unenforceable condition.

section: The term of this Agreement for the Hosted Site shall commence upon April 1, 1999 and shall continue for a period of six (6) months, unless earlier terminated in accordance with provisions hereof. This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than five (5) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: The contract term and termination conditions create a contradiction. The initial statement declares a fixed 6-month term. Subsequently, the contract introduces an automatic monthly renewal clause. Finally, it permits termination 'without cause' with 30 days' notice. This creates a conflict because the automatic renewal contradicts a fixed term, and the easy termination contradicts the idea of a commitment implicit in either a fixed-term or renewed agreement. All three sentences outline different options and conditions, thus making the text hard to follow and internally inconsistent.
